<<<<<<< HEAD
By the King whereas the Kings Maiestie hath alwayes bene ready to imbrace and cherish such a perfect amitie betweene him and the king of Spaine ... England and Wales. Sovereign (1603-1625 : James I) James I, King of England, 1566-1625.
2 leaves.
By Robert Barker, Printer to the Kings most Excellent Maiestie, Imprinted at London : Anno Dom. 1605.
Proclamation against piracy. Other title information from first 2 lines of text. "Giuen at our Castle of Windsor the viij. of Iuly 1605. in the third yeere of our Reigne of Great Britaine, France and Ireland." Imprint from colophon. Reproduction of original in: Harvard University. Library.
=======
By the King whereas the Kings Maiestie hath alwayes bene ready to imbrace and cherish such a perfect amitie betweene him and the king of Spaine ... England and Wales. Sovereign (1603-1625 : James I) James I, King of England, 1566-1625.
2 leaves.
By Robert Barker, Printer to the Kings most Excellent Maiestie, Imprinted at London : Anno Dom. 1605.
Proclamation against piracy. Other title information from first 2 lines of text. "Giuen at our Castle of Windsor the viij. of Iuly 1605. in the third yeere of our Reigne of Great Britaine, France and Ireland." Imprint from colophon. Reproduction of original in: Harvard University. Library.
